name: Fix digitalio by using chips when possible
body:
This release includes the following changes:
- Fix digitalio maintenance by removing non-special case boards #627 by @makermelissa

To use in CPython, `pip3 install adafruit-blinka`.

Read the [docs](https://circuitpython.readthedocs.io/projects/blinka/en/latest/) for info on how to use it.

name: Additional Board support and Orange Pi 4 LTS Updates
body:
This release includes the following changes:
- Adding support for Banana PI M2 Plus #619 by @zonywhoop
- Add support for aml-s905x-cc-v1 #620 by @bmol118 
- Update rockchip/rk3399pin.py to add additional pins for Orange Pi 4 LTS #621 by @twa127 

To use in CPython, `pip3 install adafruit-blinka`.

Read the [docs](https://circuitpython.readthedocs.io/projects/blinka/en/latest/) for info on how to use it.

name: libgpiod Improvements
body:
This release allows boards with different versions of libgpiod to be used. Some versions of libgpiod had a `Chip` property and some had `chip`. This allows either to be used.

For more recent version of libgpiod, Pull up and Pull down support was added and this release includes updates to make use of that.

To use in CPython, `pip3 install adafruit-blinka`.

Read the [docs](https://circuitpython.readthedocs.io/projects/blinka/en/latest/) for info on how to use it.

name: Additional Boards and Improvements
body:
This release adds the following changes:
 * Add Beaglebone Green Gateway Board Support
 * Changed actions to use python 3.7
 * Add Octavo RED and BRK board support
 * Split RP4 board definitions
 * Add generic_micropython/__init__.py

To use in CPython, `pip3 install adafruit-blinka`.

Read the [docs](https://circuitpython.readthedocs.io/projects/blinka/en/latest/) for info on how to use it.

To use in CPython, `pip3 install adafruit-blinka`.

This release includes Binho Nova performance improvements. Thanks @fig1010.

name: Fixed PyLint Coverage
body:
This release has PyLint coverage fixed to be complete along with lots of linting.

To use in CPython, `pip3 install adafruit-blinka`.

Read the [docs](https://circuitpython.readthedocs.io/projects/blinka/en/latest/) for info on how to use it.

name: Updated Beaglebone Black SPI port numbering
body:
**This release represents a potentially breaking change for SPI on BeagleBone boards**

The port numbering has changed to use spidev0 and spidev1 instead of spidev1 and spidev2 because this is the what BeagleBoard will be using going forward. It is recommended to update your software and/or make any port numbering changes.

To use in CPython, `pip3 install adafruit-blinka`.

Read the [docs](https://circuitpython.readthedocs.io/projects/blinka/en/latest/) for info on how to use it.

name: Update MCP2221
body: * Fixes a bug with GPIO settings

name: Added Support for the Odroid XU4
body:
This release adds support for Odroid XU4 (and the Odroid XU4Q fanless version).

To use in CPython, `pip3 install adafruit-blinka`.

Read the [docs](https://circuitpython.readthedocs.io/projects/blinka/en/latest/) for info on how to use it.

name: Added Support for GreatFET One
body:
Added Support for GreatFET One

To use in CPython, `pip3 install adafruit-blinka`.

body:
Updated libgpiod_pulsein with reduced CPU usage for the Raspberry Pi boards.

name: Support for the Orange Pi 2 added
body:
This release adds support for the Orange Pi 2.

To use in CPython, `pip3 install adafruit-blinka`.

Read the [docs](https://circuitpython.readthedocs.io/projects/blinka/en/latest/) for info on how to use it.

name: Added Support for Rock Pi S
body:
This release adds GPIO, I2C, SPI, UART, PWM, and AnalogIn support for the Rock Pi S.

_Note: UART is untested due to issues disabling the console causing a boot loop._

It also adds a few more tools to make it easier to add other boards.

To use in CPython, `pip3 install adafruit-blinka`.

Read the [docs](https://circuitpython.readthedocs.io/projects/blinka/en/latest/) for info on how to use it.

name: Linted, Black Formatted, and GitHub Actions Added
body:
To use in CPython, `pip3 install adafruit-blinka`.

Read the [docs](https://circuitpython.readthedocs.io/projects/blinka/en/latest/) for info on how to use it.

name: Added Support for Onion Omega2+
body:
To use in CPython, `pip3 install adafruit-blinka`.

Read the [docs](https://circuitpython.readthedocs.io/projects/blinka/en/latest/) for info on how to use it.

name: Added support for Clockwork Pi
body:
Added support for Clockwork Pi. Thanks @johalun 

To use in CPython, `pip3 install adafruit-blinka`.

name: Updated Blinka to use PureIO SPI Module instead of SpiDev
body:
* The release of Blinka is now using a new Pure Python SPI module that was recently added to Adafruit_Python_PureIO instead of SpiDev.

 * This release also has updated Pins for the Odroid C4. Thanks @hhk7734.

name: Added support for Hardkernel Odroid C4
body: Added support for Hardkernel Odroid C4. Thanks @hhk7734

name: Added support for NVIDIA Jetson NX and Beaglebone Black Wireless
body:
This release includes 
* Add support for NVIDIA Jetson NX
* Added support for Beaglebone Black Wireless
* Fixes busio Detection on Orange Pi Boards

name: Remove `_bleio`
body:
`_bleio` is now available in the separate [`adafruit-blinka-bleio`](https://github.com/adafruit/Adafruit_Blinka_bleio) package with very limited Linux support.

To use in CPython, `pip3 install adafruit-blinka`.

Read the [CircuitPython library on Raspberry Pi guide](https://learn.adafruit.com/circuitpython-on-raspberrypi-linux) for info on how to use it.

name: MCP2221 Reset Delay
body: * Changed reset behavior and added a settable delay.

name: MCP2221 HID Delay
body: * Add settable HID transfer delay to help with Windows issues.

name: Added BeagleBone Green Support
body: With BeagleBone Green now being detected correctly, this loads the BeagleBone Green board. Thanks @pdp7

name: FT232H search url updated
body: FT232H Search URL has been updated. Thanks @anekimken

name: Updated to work with refactored Platform Detect
body: This updates Blinka to work with the latest release of Platform Detect.

name: Enhance++ _bleio stub
body: Add PacketBuffer to _bleio stub for Apple Media Service library.

name: Enhance _bleio stub
body: Add _bleio APIs used in the BLE library and checked by PyLint.

name: Add Orange Pi boards
body:
Add Orange Pi boards (One, Lite, PC Plus, Plus 2E). Thanks @yeyeto2788!

_bleio is also added as a stub for use in CIs only.

name: Initial addition of Pine64 Support added
body: This release adds support for the Pine A64, also known as the original Pine64. Thanks @yeyeto2788 for your help with this.

name: Refactored AllWinner chips into separate folders
body: This will allow the addition of more AllWinner chips. Thanks @yeyeto2788!

name: Update for PyPi
body: * Missed in last release - update pyftdi version requirement for PyPi also.

name: Update pyftdi
body: * Update to use new pyftdi API for version >= 0.40.0

name: Binho Nova fixes
body:
* Fix bug introduced during a PR merge
* Add I2C frequency setting

name: Requirements updated to not require spidev on MIPS systems
body: This is to help with the Onion install.

name: Requirements updated to not install sysv_ipc on MIPS systems
PyPi Fix
body: * updated PyPi info to include `analogio`

name: Removed hidapi altogether
body: This should stop it from breaking things. :)

name: Added conditional check for hidapi
body: This is to help with broken builds.

name: Hidapi Requirement Removed
body: This is to help fix failing CircuitPython builds.

name: FT232H I2C clock frequency
body: * Add configurable I2C clock frequency for FT232H.

name: Add MCP2221(A) USB to I2C/GPIO/DAC/ADC support
body: A great low cost USB adapter chip, now fully supported

name: Blinka can now handle MultiByte Addresses
body: Added MultiByte Addressing for utilizing the update in PureIO. Thanks @ladyada.

name: Added RX and TX pin aliases for Raspberry Pi
body: Added RX and TX pin aliases for Raspberry Pi for compatibility. Thanks @Gerdie.

name: Added support for Binho Nova
body: Added support for Binho Nova to Blinka. Thanks @fig1010!

name: Added BeagleBone Black Industrial support
body: Added BeagleBone Black Industrial support. Thanks @DonPancoe

name: Blinka now supports i2c-3 on Raspberry Pi
Support for BeagleBone Green Wireless Added
body: Since this board is nearly identical to the BBB, this was a matter of loading that code if the green Wireless was detected. Thanks @crbn60!

name: Fixed mixed up idle state polarity
body:
* Fixed mixed up idle state polarity
* Fixed extra first-pulse from idle
Thanks @ladyada

name: Added stubs for micropython.natve, viper, and asm_thumb
body: This should help with future proofing some libraries. Thanks @theacodes

name: Updated Setup.py to look for SpiDev >= 3.4
body: This will hopefully help with the SpiDev version issues.

name: Thread locking added for I2C
body: Thread locking was added for thread safety when the I2C class is used in a with statement thanks to @hamishmb

name: FT232H SPI mode check
body: * Add check for allowable FT232H SPI modes

name: [Potentially Breaking Release] Updated Busio Error Type
body:
**Potentially Breaking Release**
This release has updated the error types returned if an I2C, SPI, or UART bus isn't available from busio. It has changed from **NotImplementedError** to **ValueError**. If you have code that relies on that, it will need to be updated.

name: Fixes issue with missing attribute exception catch for 'SPI.chip' on RPi
body: It now always passes on this error.

name: SPI frequency
body: Added a `frequency` property to SPI.

name: SPI Fix for Orange Pi Zero and Orange Pi R1
body: SPI Fix for Orange Pi Zero and Orange Pi R1 when no CS pin is defined.

name: Fix SPI write_readinto for FT232H
body: we have to specify duplex or it will not do what we want

name: Chunkify FT232H SPI Writes
body: * Chunkify FT232H SPI writes to deal with internal write size limit.

name: Add initial FT232H support
body: tested on linux, mac and windows (with some difficulty) you can now control i2c/spi/gpio with an ft232h and CPython

name: Fixed issue with Raspberry Pi 1 Model A not working
body: This release fixes an issue where even the the Raspberry Pi 1, Model A was being detected, a message saying Board not supported was being returned.

name: Added Orange Pi Zero Support
body: Orange Pi Zero is now supported. Thanks @hansoostendorp!

name: Updated Runtime Dependency Logic
body: Runtime Dependency logic has been updated to be more board specific. Thanks @swarren.

name: Requirements Updated
body: Requirements have been updated to require Spidev >= 3.4.

name: Jetson SPI support added
body: Jetson SPI support has been added as well as a missing requirement for the Jetson boards. Thanks @swarren.

name: Added Odroid N2 Support
body: Blinka now supports the Odroid N2 Board thanks to @paulcrawford

name: Updated SPI to handle larger buffers
body: Spi Writebytes was changed to spi Writebytes2

name: Added Raspberry Pi Compute Module Support
body: This release should allow Computer Modules CM1, CM3, and CM3+ to work.

name: Added more Pins and I2C ports for DragonBoard 410c
body: Added alternate pin names for DragonBoard 410c as well as exposed both I2C ports.

name: Add DragonBoard 410c
body: DragonBoard 410c added to Blinka

name: SPI Fixes for Orange Pi R1 and Odroid C2
body: SPI fixes for Orange Pi R1 and Odroid C2 that weren't included in the initial releases.

name: Fixes Missing Module Error on Odroid C2
body: Fixes the the `ImportError: No module named 'adafruit_blinka.microcontroller.amlogic'` error when trying to use on Odroid C2

name: Raspberry Pi with Arm64 works with BLINKA_FORCEBOARD
body: Raspberry Pi boards on arm64 now work with BLINKA_FORCEBOARD. Thanks @satmandu

name: Removed Odroid C2 from pulseio
body: Odroid C2 was removed from Pulseio

name: Added Odroid C2 Support
body: Blinka now supports the Odroid C2 Board

name: Added property to period method
body: Added property to `period` method. Thanks @brentru.

name: Minor Fix for SAMA5 Pin
body:
Minor Fixes:
 * Fix PB7 Linux pin number for SAMA5. Thanks @Groguard

name: BREAKING RELEASE: SysFS PWMOut and SPI Fixes
body:
**BREAKING RELEASE**: `close()` has been replaced by `deinit()` in `sysfs_pwmout`. To de-initialize a PWMOut object, call `deinit()` instead of `close()`.

* Added SMA5 to `set_no_cs` to allow a SPI device to setup - thanks @Groguard https://github.com/adafruit/Adafruit_Blinka/pull/124

name: SysFS PWM Fixes
body:
Minor fixes to PWMOut:
* Added a `deinit()` method to PWMOut to match the CircuitPython PWMOut API, thanks @sommersoft  https://github.com/adafruit/Adafruit_Blinka/pull/121
* Fixes SysFS PWM `Invalid Argument` error when trying to initialize a new PWMOut object, thanks @Groguard. https://github.com/adafruit/Adafruit_Blinka/pull/117

name: Added Initial Orange Pi R1 Support
body: Added Initial Orange Pi R1 Support

name: Minor SysFS PWM fixes
body: initialize more thoroughly when there may be some things already enabled, and clean up better when done.

name: Add PWM support vis SysFS
body:
Beta-quality (but working?) PWM outputs, tested on Coral (3 PWM outputs) based on
https://github.com/vsergeev/python-periphery/blob/master/periphery/pwm.py

name: Add initial PocketBeagle and Google Coral
body: there is a change in how ligpiod pins are initialized, can now use a tuple to define the gpiochip

name: Fix Jetson Nano name
body:
Also add a check for windows to not install sysv

body:

Thanks to @ladyada for adding this!

name: NeoPixel support added for Raspberry Pi
body:
NeoPixel support added for Raspberry Pi

To use in CPython, `pip3 install adafruit-blinka`.

Read the [docs](https://learn.adafruit.com/circuitpython-on-raspberrypi-linux) for info on how to use it.

name: Add write_then_readinto function for linux
body:
Linux requires a single IOCTL for repeated start i2c calls, we now support it using writeto_then_readfrom()
Also an SPI bugfix

name: Update to SPI
body: Allows for MOSI and MISO to be none.

name: I2C and SPI fixes to bring more in line with busio
body: Updates to politely cope with strings of bytes and add start/end.

name: SPI write_readinto
body: SPI hardware [write_readinto](https://circuitpython.readthedocs.io/en/3.x/shared-bindings/busio/SPI.html#busio.SPI.write_readinto) working. Tested on MCP3008.

name: Fix for unsupported boards
body: Fixes invalid machine import on Travis.

name: Initial hardware SPI support
body: SPI hardware write/readinto working - tested with BME280

name: Add missing Raspi GPIO pins
body: All GPIO should be there in board now!

name: Now includes all packages in pypi package
body: We were missing the raspi version before.

name: Include micropython module
body: Also package the `micropython` module because it includes the `const` function used in drivers.

name: Relax python requirement
body: Support python3.4 to match CircuitPython and MicroPython

name: Release fix (hopefully)
body: Library is same as 0.1.0
Blink is an implementation of the circuitpython hardware api for CPython. this is the initial release with some working raspberry pi support code. very alpha - use at your peril :)
